alert.note: Alert for Blue Earth; Faribault; Freeborn; Martin; Steele; Waseca; Watonwan (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Warning issued December 15 at 2:59AM CST until December 16 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...POTENTIALLY HISTORIC HIGH WIND EVENT TONIGHT... .A very powerful low pressure system will track through later today and this evening. Damaging winds with gusts of 60 to 65 mph are likely across all of the Upper Mississippi River Valley tonight. In addition, a line of severe thunderstorms will develop along a very fast moving cold front early this evening. This line of thunderstorms could contain gusts in excess of 80 mph and some embedded tornadoes across southern and eastern Minnesota into western Wisconsin. ...HIGH WIND WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 AM CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Southwest winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 65 mph expected. * WHERE...Freeborn, Steele, Waseca, Blue Earth, Watonwan, Faribault and Martin Counties. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to 6 AM CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages are expected. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Widespread wind damage may also occur with a line of thunderstorms early this evening. Some wind gusts may exceed 80 mph.
info.instruction: People should avoid being outside in forested areas and around trees and branches. If possible, remain in the lower levels of your home during the windstorm, and avoid windows. Use caution if you must drive.

area.areaDesc: Blue Earth; Faribault; Freeborn; Martin; Steele; Waseca; Watonwan
